article_text:
Political prosecutions are far too common these days, so thank heavens for the courts. On Wednesday the highest criminal court in Texas threw out the last of two indictments in the egregious case against former Republican Governor Rick Perry.

Special prosecutor Michael McCrum persuaded a Travis County grand jury to indict then-Gov. Perry in 2014 of the high crime of vetoing legislation. Seriously. In 2013 Mr. Perry threatened to veto $7.5 million in funding for the public integrity arm of the Travis County district...

twitter.description: A court throws out the lawless charges against former Texas Governor Rick Perry, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Exonerating Rick Perry

On Wednesday the highest criminal court in Texas threw out the last of two indictments in the egregious case against former Republican Governor Rick Perry.
In 2013 Mr. Perry threatened to veto $7.5 million in funding for the public integrity arm of the Travis County district...
Special prosecutor Michael McCrum persuaded a Travis County grand jury to indict then-Gov.
Perry in 2014 of the high crime of vetoing legislation.
Political prosecutions are far too common these days, so thank heavens for the courts.
